ratings.comment: Calc  221: Bad professor. She does not come prepared to lecture. She makes mistakes in lecture. Not personable at all. She will call on someone in lecture to answer a question that obviously no one knows but her and she will  criticize the student for getting it wrong. Not a tough class but watch out for trick questions just because she can

She is more than willing to help, but lectures were so unorganized. Any of my friends who took calc 221 with a different professor were much happier. She has favorites and does not really support those who are not the best at math and who may need extra help.
Awful.

Lecture does not seem to have any clear direction. You may be able to understand the lecture, but when it comes to the homework and tests sometimes you wonder if they are even for the same class. Going to office hours results in you working the problems out on the whiteboard, and she makes you tough through them which can be good and bad.

The worst.  Avoid at all cost.  She does not follow the syllabus or the book so it's next to impossible to find explanations in the book.  Tests are hard.  You will fail if you don't work hard.  The good part about her is the massive amount of mistakes she makes while doing explanations.  There are a ton.  It's hilarious.
Tests are extremely tough and she's obsessed with apples and uses them a lot in lecture so some material may be confusing.

Shirin's lectures were not helpful at all. She never introduced the concepts we were to discuss and was very unclear in her approach to teach us. She put material on the homework that we had not gone over and her exams were very difficult. Always go to discussion so you get full points for attendance.

She seems nice and funny. She has online homework twice a week that takes maybe 30 minutes each and written homework once a week that takes maybe an hour. Quizzes once a week that are of medium difficulty. Her exams are total garbage. She doesn't really prepare you well for them. Also shes really into participation which is annoying. leave me alone

I would've given her an all 5 if it is the beginning of the semester. Her lecture was really good then. However, in the last month she made her lecture the most confusing by making series of mistakes and skipping key concepts or didn't explain them as well as what she did at the beginning of the semester. I just ended up watching online lectures.

She makes LOTS OF mistakes on lectures, assignments, moodles, even exams. She even messed up her last lecture before the evaluation. It is funny she always skips what you really need to know (i.e. fundamental theorems of calculus). I believe there are better professors for Calculus 1.

She makes a lot of mistakes in lectures and sometimes it seems as if I could teach the class better myself. You spend most of the time in lecture reviewing word problems that are way too hard and confusing for majority of the class, and the ones that never show up on exams. If you have already taken a calc class, just go to discussion

This class is terrible. Shirin makes mistakes EVERY lecture. I swear half of the kids in her class know more math than her (me included). The grading is unfair, as some bigger problems will be about 10 points and smaller problems about 20. How does that work? Wish I knew. She's off topic more often than being on topic. Pick a different teacher.

Worst class I have ever taken. Do not take calculus, do not take it with Shirin. She trys to have participation in lecture which is next to impossible. She makes mistakes in class. 2 midterms, attendance counts. Online and written homework. Quizzes by Keith really freaking hard. Homework was graded. Impossible teacher to learn from.

Hard class taught by an even harder professor. Had a true or false section on exam, the answer was partially true.  Enjoys "My Big Fat Greek Wedding" and promotes it in class. Ended up going to Khan Academy to learn material more effectively.

Lectures are confusing and long. She LOVES class participation. However, she makes SO many mistakes on tests, quizzes, homework, lectures, etc. If you have an assignment, there WILL be a mistake, no doubt. I learned more from my TA than I did from her lectures all year. Test are hard and she doesn't prepare you for them. I would avoid if possible.

Her lectures tend to be confusing. She tends to make mistakes in her own problems and is usually corrected by students. Be prepared during lecture because she expects participation. The tests she gives are very difficult. Also, the weekly homework is lengthy and challenging. Wouldn't recommend her if you are just starting calculus.

Although her lecture is clear, she spend too much time in discussing the basic definition and rules and little time in how to apply those things which she requires students managing to do in the exams.
Does not have any idea to teach future elementary teachers. Avoid her at all costs for this class. Did not follow textbook or syllabus at all.

Shirin is a great professor. Lectures are very well organized and she presents the material very well. Exams are challenging, but definitely doable. Most exam questions come from the book so take the time to do extra problems.

WORKED MY ASS OFF. On final i got a 55/150 and that was considered 10% above average... She is a great lecture teacher, u learn alot but her tests were flat out unfair. She does not curve well, like at most 5% even if class avg was 55%, so get ready for that.  at a

I think Shirin is very fair in terms of exams and grading, and the class was definitely worthwhile, but she makes mistakes constantly during lecture. It's almost as if she doesn't prepare for lecture at all.
I really liked her as a prof but her class is very hard and tests are ridiculous. Although, there is a curve at the end.
Really takes the time to explain each topic & can find a way to explain topic to all students.  She's very nice & funny.  Great for Math 340

great professor, probably the best I've had in the math department. You actually learn something in lecture. She cares about her students learning the material and is very willing to answer questions.

Great professor and explains the concepts of calculus very well. Frequently makes mistakes during lectures though. Her midterms aren't bad, most the time they're questions directly from the book. And her final has a lot of similar questions to previous midterms. As long as you do the assigned problems and pay attention, it should be pretty easy.
She is the best professor I ever took in Wisconsin! Most of her exam will be on the examples of the textbook. So please do read textbook example carefully!

I actually really liked her. She did a very good job of explaining concepts and doing examples. That said- Calc is an extremely difficult class, plus a lot depends on the quality of the TA you are assigned, so it still is tough to do exceptionally well.

Nice professor, but she kind of teaches like she's teaching 6th graders at times, and at other times she teaches like she expects everyone to already know the material she's teaching. Her exams are way harder than anything else you do in the class, and they're graded way harder than they need to be. You'll get sick of hearing about apples, too.

She is a nice professor, however, she doesn't do a great job of explaining. She mostly just expects you to know or remember material from past years and will just do an example on the board without going through it step by step. Be ready to wait for her, she frequently messes up her own examples. Class is difficult w/o prior Calc exp.!!

She covers the material very broadly leaving you or your TA to fill in.  However if you have a TA who doesn't even speak in class like I did, you basically have to teach yourself or spend unnecessary time in the math lab.  Curve is unfair.  I did better than the class average on exams and I will still get a D in the class.
She's a decent teacher but sometimes it seems like she is a little out there and messes up her own examples.

Had Calc before - found this class to be rather difficult. If you've had Calc before it shouldn't be too hard because she'll review most basic Calc I concepts but her exams can be difficult if you don't prepare well. Homework and attendence isn't necessary but highly recommended since it nets you extra points. Not a bad class, just not great.
She was a great professor.  Very clear and you could tell that she really wanted her students to learn.  Do the homework problems because a few of the exam problems were taken straight from the book!
She was a very enthusiastic teacher and did a fabulous job of presenting the material and making sure everyone's questions were answered clearly.
She's really good, interesting, enthusiastic, and the class is set up to make sure you learn the material and get a good grade. You'd have to try to get lower than a B.
Really good teacher. Funny. Midterms were easy, but the final was pretty hard. Lecture is mandatory, she gives worksheets to check attendance.

Malekpour is a very thorough and clear lecturer. She makes sure everyone understands her lessons, and really knows what she is doing. Her tests are hard, but fair and if you do the homework you'll be fine. Would definitely recommend her.

Prof Malekpour is awesome! She creates an atmosphere similar to a high school math class- very interactive. She makes sure that all students are participating. I love taking college geometry with her- I highly recommend!

Despite her foreign sounding name, her accent does not at all hinder her clarity of speech.  Her clarity of teaching, however, is more of a problem.  She's very scatterbrained, and frequently messes up problems.  If you can get by this, she cares about how well her students do in the class.  She's a very nice woman!

A fine teacher.  She is foreign, but her accent is totally understandable.  She has fair tests and as long as you do the homework, you will be fine.  I got an A and didn't take even one page of notes thru the class.  You will spend lots of time on the mandatory homework.

if you do the suggested homework problems from the book you will do well in the class. i did horribly on the midterms but aced the final and ended up with an A in the class. Take advantage of office hours and any tutoring available though.

Despite the name she speaks very well and her accent is understandable.  You get points for coming to lecture and doing the worksheets. About 500 points total in class(100 discussion, 100 for each of two midterms, and 200 point final)  Exams are not bad if you study old exams and do homework.  Old exams will give you a good start on studying.

Very fun a quirky teacher! She got a little scatterbrained and messed up a few examples when she was working through them, but everyone makes a couple mistakes especially in front of hundreds of college students. She kept my interest. exams don't reflect the previous years, but she probably got through more material than last year

Very thorough lecturer. Some thought she was annoying, but I didn't mind her. Calc is a very hard class, but she is a great teacher. A good TA is also very helpful. Exams can be hard, and don't accurately reflect the old practice exams. Any extra tutoring/office hours are encouraged. Join math tutorial program if you're struggling - good practice.

She's nice~don't be surpirised if she draws apples and uses 47 all the time~her class is helpful and she uses work sheet to record attendence. A good lecturer, she makes 3 lectures a week don't seem to many.

She is very helpful and wants you to do well.  The class can be hard, but there is a big curve at the end.  I recommend her if you have to take calculus because she will prepare you well for future math classes.
Very important to go to lecture every day. She is very willing to help you. Exams can be tough if you aren't well prepared.
pretty usefull

Very good lecturer. You need to go to all the lectures and discussion sections if you want to do well, but the tests are definitely easier than the homework. The final curve was extremely generous. Quizes once a week made by the TA's weren't bad either.

Required lectures, and weekly quizzes. Great lecturer, and VERY approachable. Provides examples in lecture and keeps everything simple. First time teaching math 221, but does a great job of preparing for calc 222 cuz she normally taught that. High class avg on tests, around 80 each time, so there is virtually no curve. 93% overall required for an A
Very easy tests.  Explains and re-explains every concept almost too much if you have any idea what is going on.  Required lectures and TA quizzes part of total grade.

Math222 is the hardest class you'll take at Madison. That said Malekpour did a good job with it and understands what students struggle with and makes sure the class understands. Homework is not required unless you want to pass the exams. Exams are like 1 really hard question from each topic so you better have a firm understanding.

Very clear and does lots of examples.  The tests are super easy.  She really cares about students and tries to keep everyone engaged.  I will definitely take her again if I get the chance and I whole-heartedly recommend her!

Ignore the 114 comments; Shirin is approachable and a good professor for calc if you keep up with the material. Go to lecture and discussion, do some homework, and focus on concepts. Tests are fair--don't let the problems out of the book scare you too much, her tests are a lot simpler. Not an easy class, but that's what math 211 is for.
She's a great professor. Material was really easy, just ATTEND CLASS. She does a lot of examples in class, which really helps you understand it. Recommnded!
Excellent.
Great professor, knows the material she is teaching and always willing to answer questions when material is difficult or unclear.  Highly recommended.  Very nice, also.
study from the worksheets and do the hw and you will be better than fine

I really liked Shirin. She was super clear, gave tons of examples, what she talked about in lectures was on the tests, she had a generous curve at the end, and she was genuinely concerned about her students. The class sucks but she did her best to make it bearable and really tried to help us all succeed. Take anything with her if possible!
Seriously I don't know how you can't do well in this class. If you go and listen her worksheets make it easy to understand. Never did homework or studied and got a 97%

Shirin is not a good teacher...You learn way more in your 50 min discussion then you do in her lections...and get use to the phrase "How many ways there are" cuz she uses it alot when asking you questions in class.  If you get the chance take this course from someone else

I actually ended up liking this class, which I wasn't expecting. As long as you study really hard for the first exam, you'll probably do fine. And seriously, if you can't understand what Shirin says through her accent, you're retarded! I have had teachers with strong accents and she is not one of them at all.

This was not a hard class. She tells you the first few chapters are the hardest and its true, if you get through the first test the rest of the class is a breeze. She is very willing to explain things again if you dont understand. However, the notes can be very unorganized.

I liked Shirin a lot. Students say shes unclear and has a big accent but they need to get over themselves. She has a slight accent and its very easy 2 understand her if ur not unnecessarily judgemental. She breaks things down from A-Z in a way that makes sense, if u miss parts then u mite not understand, but shes def willing to help. Exams r easy

Shirin sucks- she  speaks Farci as her native language and doesn't know how to say some things in English.  Can you say, Confusing?!  Her voice inflections make me want to gag, and so do her impossible tests.  She is a bad teacher, DO NOT take this class.  The other teacher with Math 210 has much easier tests and is much better.

On the plus side she is always willing to help and one-on-one she is very good. her tests are horrible and the class shouldn't be this hard. the material isn't hard somehow though she manages to make it confusing.
Horrible professor.... hardly understood a word she said and had to teach myself all the material.  Avoid her at all costs!
She's great one on one but is a horrible lecturer.
Easily the worst professor at UW. Bottom line, she should not be teaching 3rd grade art, let alone college math. If anyone from the math department reads this. Please fire her. She is a joke
do not under any circumstances take a class with this professor...thats all that needs to be said. she sucks.

Very unclear, shrill accent... makes up numbers during examples... The material itself isn't that hard, but trying to understand her explanations is what made it relatively hard. No cumulative final, just four midterms. That's a huge plus. But overall, the only way to get through her class is to have a good TA.

Probably worst professor on campus.  During a lecture before a medterm she decides to give us information to confuse us and says, "Well you'll just have to unconfuse yourself before the test Monday." Final impossible in the given time.
She's just downright annoying
makes many mistakes during lecture, and her exams blow, very hard on grading since all the TA's do it.

Pay no attention to the influx of rants from the mentally deficient agricultural journalism majors leaving reviews for Math 114.  She's a clear communicator, easy grader and laid-back person.  She may talk about apples in your class, but you deserve it because you're in remedial math.  This class was a breeze and very enjoyable.

She is a terrible teacher, but in response to the last post, she does curve the class at the end of the semester.  This can be a good thing, but it is hard to know where you stand in this class until she sets the curve.  She is a very unfair teacher as far as grading and exam expectations.

Below average teacher, terrible grading system.  She doesn't make clear what is expected of you on the tests.  This wouldn't be a problem if we all thought exactly like her and solved problems like her.  This is compounded by the fact that she doesn't use a curve which she really should use to compensate for her terrible teaching skills.
She is very unclear and tends to make easy material seem difficult, I would not recommend taking one of her classes
I almost failed this class, and I did not find her helpful.

I thought Shirin was awesome.  I had her over the summer, so obviously there was a lot of material to cover in a short time. She makes you work, but she's great. Don't let the other reviewers (from math 114, no less) discourage you from taking her classes

Given the selection of math professors this past semester, she was probably the best choice. I didn't find her particularly good or bad. She wasn't funny, but given the topics we covered, the class was acceptable. I don't think the exams would have been as difficult as they felt if we could have had something better to use to prepare for it.

Math 222 is probably one of the hardest classes you will ever take, regardless of the professor, but Dr. Malekpour doesn't help the cause at all. Her exams are tough, her final was insanely hard, and her curve is very unfair. She gets confused easily when going through examples, and doesn't convey the material very well. Find a different professor.

She is a nice person outside of class, but not in lecture.She doesn't really explain the hard subjects.Her exs. are the easiest problems in the chapters, but then gives you the hardest on the tests.The tests are super hard(I wanted to cry when I got the final).The tests are worth so much when there are not many questions(the final had 150 pts:7 Qs)
No Comments

I think she's a very bright woman, but she lacks the skills to teach.... therefore she shouldn't be a teacher, because the ones who suffer the consequences are the students.  Man that was an awful class, I wasted my time studying like a psycho for the final, and I wasted my money because I probably failed the class.  Way to screw us over Shirin!

Lectures are usually very unclear and mixed up.  Most of the time she doesn't tell you what section of the book she is teaching.  Exams are fair, but can be hard and are graded very critically.  Hopefully you get a good TA like I did.

The final exam was suppose to be cumulative and it ended up being on the last two weeks of class.  She had 3 problems on conics on the exam out of 7 problems, and she taught conics in one day, the week before the exam.  Aweful...this coming from a former varsity math team captain, thanks for wasting my money!

i think the people in 114 need to cut her a break...the class was filled with jerks who talked through the whole lecture, i can see why she would get angry. she is extremely helpful if you go to office hours, actually a VERY nice woman. tests are hard but fair- mainly based off of problems she did in lecture...go to lecture and you'll be fine.

this class could be so easy except she over complicates everything, she doesn't even tell you what she is trying teach about.  and what the hell apple and pears? i'm sorry i thought i was in a math class not the grocery store!

Prof. Malekpour is the worst professor I have ever experienced.  Her teaching methods are ridiculously convoluted, making studying for exams near impossible.  Pray for a fabulous TA, otherwise you will never excel in this course.
Shirin Malekpour sucks, at least at 114. Gives about 130 math problems a week and asks stupid questions like "everybody happy?"
Her tests are difficult. She vaguely explains the topics. Gives us easy examples, then puts extremely difficult problems on the tests.
One word... apples
the 1st problem on her tests is no partial credit...dont take her. shes very unclear and doesnt follow anything in the book
She always makes mistakes, so wait a second before you copy anything off the board.  She makes you feel like you are a stupid high schooler.  Don't talk in class because she'll call you out on it.
easy tests if you do all the homework
its a task to sit through the lecture with her. never tells you what material will be covered on any of the exams or finals, even when you ask her personaly she will not tell you.
She's a very good Prof, especially compared to the others Profs this semester. She's quite slow and clear, and rather easy to follow. I think she's really not bad!
A terrible teacher. She doesn't have a clear workflow on the board, so following her is next to impossible. Loves to perform mathematical operations with apples.
Bring an eraser because she is going to make a ton of errors during every lecture. She'll show you work from Calc 2 when we haven't even seen Calc 1. Avoid taking her if at all possible.
